description.narrative: Le projet vise à accroître d’une façon significative la couverture des aires protégées du Mali, et à renforcer l’efficacité du système de la gestion des aires protégées en mettant l’accent sur la région Sud-Ouest.
populated place
forest reserve
populated place
populated place
populated place
park
stream
region
populated place
second-order administrative division
second-order administrative division
Management models at three pilot PA units will provide replicable examples of best practices management for sustainable cost effective PA management in Mali
8 Basic PA management tools in place Management plan PA Manager staff and resources available

comment.narrative:
8a No active Management Plan for any of the pilot PAs
8b No permanent staff or management for any of pilot PAs

8a Management plans available electronically
8b Manager and staff in place and trained
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014 there are no quantifiable targets for these subindicators which is not useful We will propose something based on the subcomplexes of PAs after the MTR and upon their advice

Target considered achieved as per the MTR
The MTR reports
8a The 4 FMP of the Wongo complex have been realized Kouroufing NP Wongo NP Hunting Area of Flawa Chimpanzees Sanctuary FMP have been realized but no yet validated FMP for Faragama Hunting Area has not been realized
8b Staff has been recruited and is in place on the Wongo complex Even though they dont reach a sufficient number its a significant progress regarding the initial situation before the project They have been equipped with motorbikes Infrastructures have been restored a forest post in Niarakira has been restored and one is being constructed in Kouroukoto
In conclusion the MTR evaluates this indicator to be satisfying according to the progresses made

8a Management plans available electronically
8b Manager and staff in place and trained
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014 there are no quantifiable targets for these subindicators which is not useful We will propose something based on the subcomplexes of PAs after the MTR and upon their advice

Target considered achieved as per the MTR
The MTR reports
8a The 4 FMP of the Wongo complex have been realized Kouroufing NP Wongo NP Hunting Area of Flawa Chimpanzees Sanctuary FMP have been realized but no yet validated FMP for Faragama Hunting Area has not been realized
8b Staff has been recruited and is in place on the Wongo complex Even though they dont reach a sufficient number its a significant progress regarding the initial situation before the project They have been equipped with motorbikes Infrastructures have been restored a forest post in Niarakira has been restored and one is being constructed in Kouroukoto
In conclusion the MTR evaluates this indicator to be satisfying according to the progresses made

description.narrative: 7 Management Effectiveness of PAs at project sites METT Scorecard

comment.narrative:
Kouroufing 17102 Wongo 18102
Chimpanzee Sanctuary 18102
Mande Wula WR 18102
Yoroya CFR 13102
indicator adjusted with respect to the total possible score it should be noted that METT was also applied for the Chimpanzee Sanctuary and Yoroya even though baseline results were not included in the PRODOCs Annex 3

Kouroufing 30102
Wongo 30102
Chimpanzee Sanctuary 30102
Mande Wula WR 28102
Yoroya CFR 25102
indicator adjusted with respect to the total possible score

Targets surpassed for the six METT sites assessed in July 2015
The MTR has validated the METT application and reports the following
See comments of indicator 2 redundancy
The following results have been granted by the MTR MidTerm Report
1 Kouroufing NP 40
2 MW Reserve 40
3 NW Reserve 40
4 Wongo NP 42
5 Chimps Sanctuary 57
6 Yoroya Community Reserve 29
The Wongo complex presents important progresses These PA have gone from a theoretical onpaper status to an implementation status Thus scores have improved significantly
The GaléLimakollé legally exists even disposes of a FMP even though it is not yet validated but is facing to a major occupation issue by populations
Moreover community reserves only are at the very first step of their creation the legal process absolutely must result by the end of the project
The MTR rates this indicator S for Satisfactory regarding the progresses attained since the project started

Wongo 30102

1 Kouroufing NP 40
2 MW Reserve 40
3 NW Reserve 40
4 Wongo NP 42
5 Chimps Sanctuary 57
6 Yoroya Community Reserve 29
The Wongo complex presents important progresses These PA have gone from a theoretical onpaper status to an implementation status Thus scores have improved significantly
The GaléLimakollé legally exists even disposes of a FMP even though it is not yet validated but is facing to a major occupation issue by populations
Moreover community reserves only are at the very first step of their creation the legal process absolutely must result by the end of the project
The MTR rates this indicator S for Satisfactory regarding the progresses attained since the project started

description.narrative: 9 Alternative Livelihoods generate increased revenues for local populations

comment.narrative: No ecotourism economic activities in region
3 new community based ecotourism operations generating revenue and jobs

Target not achieved No ecotourism activity
A directory of cultural sites is outstanding preparation If people were well involved in the project the majority of respondents say villagers see protected areas as constraints and not as an opportunity especially income generation Alternative activities initiated by the project will have to be intensified in order to have a significant impact on local populations of protected areas Moreover given the countrys instability which strongly impacts tourism and very limited resources lack of cofinancing anticipated investment in ecotourism home can be very risky
The MTR reports
Even though populations have been involved in the project the majority of enquired villagers see PA as constraints and not as an opportunity Alternative activities initiated by the project will have to be intensified to have a significant impact on the populations living near the PA The project team could not provide any socioeconomic study quantifying generated income of the projects beneficiaries Moreover given the countrys instability strongly impacting tourism and the limited resources absence of expected cofunding the MTR warns on the risk inherent in investing in ecotouristic welcoming
Project team has been asked to lead a reflection on it and reconsider this objective if needed
In conclusion the MTR assesses that the objective will not be reached by the end of December 2015 It recommends to revise the initial objective of creating 3 sites of ecotourism to focus on one pilot even 0 according to the results of the reflection led by the project team and reinforce alternative activities with populations living near PA in particular by developing partnerships with the projects of the given zone
3 new community based ecotourism operations generating revenue and jobs

Target not achieved No ecotourism activity
A directory of cultural sites is outstanding preparation If people were well involved in the project the majority of respondents say villagers see protected areas as constraints and not as an opportunity especially income generation Alternative activities initiated by the project will have to be intensified in order to have a significant impact on local populations of protected areas Moreover given the countrys instability which strongly impacts tourism and very limited resources lack of cofinancing anticipated investment in ecotourism home can be very risky
The MTR reports
Even though populations have been involved in the project the majority of enquired villagers see PA as constraints and not as an opportunity Alternative activities initiated by the project will have to be intensified to have a significant impact on the populations living near the PA The project team could not provide any socioeconomic study quantifying generated income of the projects beneficiaries Moreover given the countrys instability strongly impacting tourism and the limited resources absence of expected cofunding the MTR warns on the risk inherent in investing in ecotouristic welcoming
Project team has been asked to lead a reflection on it and reconsider this objective if needed
In conclusion the MTR assesses that the objective will not be reached by the end of December 2015 It recommends to revise the initial objective of creating 3 sites of ecotourism to focus on one pilot even 0 according to the results of the reflection led by the project team and reinforce alternative activities with populations living near PA in particular by developing partnerships with the projects of the given zone

description.narrative: Objective Expand the coverage of Malis protected estate and strengthen the management effectiveness of the protected area system focusing in the Southwest region and piloting new management models based on international PA categories
3 Decrease in conversion of gallery forests and forested savannahs to agricultural land

Annual deforestation
Gallery forests
Forested savannahs

Gallery forests 05
Forested savannahs 2 per annum including rotation agriculture

Target achieved and surpassed
The MTR has reviewed the METT applied to 6 sites and obtained an average rating of 33 Details follow for points over a total possible of 102
1 Kouroufing National Park 40
2 Mande Wula Reserve 40
3 Néma Wula Reserve 40
4 Wongo national Park 42
5 Chimpanzees Sanctuary 57
6 Yoroya Community Reserve 29
The MTR further added that the rise of the average ratings was linked to the creation of the PA or implementation of onpaper PA or to their border demarcation The MTR assessed progress as satisfactory for this indicator

description.narrative: 1 Increase in land area of national territory managed as a Protected Area

comment.narrative:
In 2010 baseline situation Mali counted on the following with respect to its PA estate and key areas in the South West part of the country
1a The countrys PA estate covers 5589476 hectares of gazetted protected areas covering 45 of Malis land area
1b Key habitats in the BafingFaleme region remain unprotected or were only recently gazetted
1c There is a project to create the BafingFaleme Biosphere Reserve as the first Transboundary Biosphere Reserve in Mali composed of a mosaic of PAs of different categories and under varied management regimes but only timid steps have been taken in this effectively creating the reserve
1d Within the central subcomplex of what will potentially be the Malian side of the BafingFaleme Transboundary Biosphere Reserve there are at least 250000 ha of paper parks or areas that are gazetted by law but not managed These include
i Wongo National Park 53599 ha
ii Kouroufing National Park 55770ha
iii Chimpanzee Sanctuary 67200 ha
iv Falawa Game Hunting Preserves ZIC 73940 ha
indicator adjusted through a more detailed explanation NOTE on LOGFRAME 2014 the text has been broken up in three numbered subindicators for the sake of readability no change to content made
Note from 1a Malis total territory covers 12 million sq km or more precisely 124113800 ha

By project end there will be major progress in expanding and operationalising Malis PA estate
1a The countrys PA estate reaches approximately 6270000 ha of gazetted PAs covering at least 5 of Mali land area This expansion will generally add 700000 ha of new protected areas to the estate of which i some 100000 ha are expected to be created within the target zone of the project and ii some 600000 ha would be from the establishment of the Tamesna Faunal Reserve for Gazelles in the TinEssakoKidal Region and for which the project is not responsible but may function as a catalyst eg through Output 12 on the PA Strategy
1b The zoning of the BafingFaleme Biosphere Reserve has been completed and a master plan for managing the Reserve as mosaic of protected areas of different categories and under varied management regimes provides protection to key habitats in the BafingFaleme region
1c The BafingFaleme Transboundary Biosphere Reserve has been created ie the legal dossiers for submission to UNESCO have been cleared at the countrys level in close coordination with the Government of Guinea and the documentation submitted to UNESCOs Assembly for approval
1d Former 250000 ha paper parks in the central subcomplex of the BafingFaleme Transboundary Biosphere plus some 100000 ha of new PAs within the mentioned reserve are under improved management this is evidenced by METT scores of 30 or above for the mentioned areas indicator adjusted through a more detailed explanation
NOTE on LOGFRAME 2014 the text has been broken up in three numbered subindicators for the sake of readability no change to content made
Note from 1a Output 12 reads National PA Strategy under preparation considers among other relevant factors the role of the new PA Authority sustainable financing options longterm PA expansion and consolidation potential climate change impacts on the PA system and defines immediate site action interventions for highly threatened PAs or endangered species dependent on a series of PAs

Making progress towards the target but given the implementation time left and the complexity of the tasks the target of PA expansion and strengthening is not likely to be achieved
After independent scrutiny by the MTR the following was concluded on this indicator
1a Only A PA of 32657 ha was created as a result of the project Order of the 9 May 2011 namely the Hunting area of Faragama Thus only 33 of the target of 100000 ha new PAs within the project zone was achieved Given local conflict in the area a forest management plan FMP has not been completed In addition activities in Community Reserves totalling 167699 ha are only at the first steps of implementation No community reserve CR was formally created with the assistance of the project In fact the legal process of CR creation has not even begun A precondition to it would be the adoption of the Law on Wildlife and its Habitat which is still in draft It will only be submitted for approval in September 2015 with expected adoption by December 2015 if the process is not made contentious Then the PA proclamation decrees would need to be submitted At best the proclamation of these community reserves would only be expected by June 2016 and therefore too late for the project to have an influence on it
1b The project has supported the management of 6 existing PA for a total 344149 ha These are i Kouroufing NP with 55770 ha ii Wongo NP with 53499 ha iii Bafing Chimpanzees Sanctuary with 67200 ha iv Flawa Hunting Preserve 739440 ha v Manda Wula Wildlife Reserve 39050 ha vi Mene and related Wildlife Reserve and its buffer and transition zone BTZ with 54690 ha PA strengthening activities have taken place but are still limited due to the lack of cofunding The management plans for Neme Wula and Mande Wula have not yet been approved by a MEADD order
1c The crossborder biosphere reserve is not created The MTR assessed that it wont be by the end of the project
Overall the MTR assessed that the MTR estimates tan the objective of this indicator is unlikely to be reached by the end and that if new PAs are still created these will be paper parks with no management on the ground Therefore the MTR suggested that the project should focus on the five CR with a total of 69912 ha
The projects replica is
Progress is being made to reach the target of creating new areas The estimates are around 167699 ha of new community areas to have created that have been delineated by boundary To achieve the objective the project has to go to the other steps of the classification process constitution of the classification committee publication of the limits of the new areas pending claims of riparian communities analysis of claims classification report and preparation of the act of filing its adoption and publication in the Official Journal The creation of the new board of management of protected areas is underway
Overall performance for this indicator was deemed as MU by the MTR

By project end there will be major progress in expanding and operationalising Malis PA estate
1a The countrys PA estate reaches approximately 6270000 ha of gazetted PAs covering at least 5 of Mali land area This expansion will generally add 700000 ha of new protected areas to the estate of which i some 100000 ha are expected to be created within the target zone of the project and ii some 600000 ha would be from the establishment of the Tamesna Faunal Reserve for Gazelles in the TinEssakoKidal Region and for which the project is not responsible but may function as a catalyst eg through Output 12 on the PA Strategy
1b The zoning of the BafingFaleme Biosphere Reserve has been completed and a master plan for managing the Reserve as mosaic of protected areas of different categories and under varied management regimes provides protection to key habitats in the BafingFaleme region
1c The BafingFaleme Transboundary Biosphere Reserve has been created ie the legal dossiers for submission to UNESCO have been cleared at the countrys level in close coordination with the Government of Guinea and the documentation submitted to UNESCOs Assembly for approval
1d Former 250000 ha paper parks in the central subcomplex of the BafingFaleme Transboundary Biosphere plus some 100000 ha of new PAs within the mentioned reserve are under improved management this is evidenced by METT scores of 30 or above for the mentioned areas indicator adjusted through a more detailed explanation
NOTE on LOGFRAME 2014 the text has been broken up in three numbered subindicators for the sake of readability no change to content made
Note from 1a Output 12 reads National PA Strategy under preparation considers among other relevant factors the role of the new PA Authority sustainable financing options longterm PA expansion and consolidation potential climate change impacts on the PA system and defines immediate site action interventions for highly threatened PAs or endangered species dependent on a series of PAs

Making progress towards the target but given the implementation time left and the complexity of the tasks the target of PA expansion and strengthening is not likely to be achieved
After independent scrutiny by the MTR the following was concluded on this indicator
1a Only A PA of 32657 ha was created as a result of the project Order of the 9 May 2011 namely the Hunting area of Faragama Thus only 33 of the target of 100000 ha new PAs within the project zone was achieved Given local conflict in the area a forest management plan FMP has not been completed In addition activities in Community Reserves totalling 167699 ha are only at the first steps of implementation No community reserve CR was formally created with the assistance of the project In fact the legal process of CR creation has not even begun A precondition to it would be the adoption of the Law on Wildlife and its Habitat which is still in draft It will only be submitted for approval in September 2015 with expected adoption by December 2015 if the process is not made contentious Then the PA proclamation decrees would need to be submitted At best the proclamation of these community reserves would only be expected by June 2016 and therefore too late for the project to have an influence on it
1b The project has supported the management of 6 existing PA for a total 344149 ha These are i Kouroufing NP with 55770 ha ii Wongo NP with 53499 ha iii Bafing Chimpanzees Sanctuary with 67200 ha iv Flawa Hunting Preserve 739440 ha v Manda Wula Wildlife Reserve 39050 ha vi Mene and related Wildlife Reserve and its buffer and transition zone BTZ with 54690 ha PA strengthening activities have taken place but are still limited due to the lack of cofunding The management plans for Neme Wula and Mande Wula have not yet been approved by a MEADD order
1c The crossborder biosphere reserve is not created The MTR assessed that it wont be by the end of the project
Overall the MTR assessed that the MTR estimates tan the objective of this indicator is unlikely to be reached by the end and that if new PAs are still created these will be paper parks with no management on the ground Therefore the MTR suggested that the project should focus on the five CR with a total of 69912 ha
The projects replica is
Progress is being made to reach the target of creating new areas The estimates are around 167699 ha of new community areas to have created that have been delineated by boundary To achieve the objective the project has to go to the other steps of the classification process constitution of the classification committee publication of the limits of the new areas pending claims of riparian communities analysis of claims classification report and preparation of the act of filing its adoption and publication in the Official Journal The creation of the new board of management of protected areas is underway
Overall performance for this indicator was deemed as MU by the MTR

description.narrative: Simplified indicator 1 repeat

comment.narrative: Subindicators a b and c as originally formulated by the project

Targets
1a 57 million ha 100000 ha of new PAs
1b Good management of 350000 ha of existing APs and 100 000 ha of new APs
1c Creating crossborder of biosphere reserve

1a An AP with a total area of 32 657 ha was established by the project by order of 9 May 2011 This is the ZIC of Faragama Thus only 33 of the target was achieved PAG was not performed
The activities in Community Reserves relate 167699 ha but are the first stage of implementation No Community reserve was formally created
Indeed the legal process of establishing the Community Reserve has not begun The prerequisite is the adoption of the bill on wildlife and its habitat But the draft text will be submitted in September 2015 at best hoped for adoption by December 2015 Then the legal texts on the 12 RC should be submitted
1b The project has supported the management of six existing APs from a total of 344 149 ha National Park Kouroufing 55770 ha National Park Wongo 53 499 ha Sanctuary of the chimpanzees Bafing 67 200 ha ZIC Flawa of 73 940 ha Mande Wula Wildlife Reserve 39050 ha wildlife reserves of Nema Wula and ZTT 54 690 ha Field activities exist but are still limited particularly due to the virtual absence of cofinancing Management Plans and reserve management Mande Wula and Nema Wula have not yet been officially approved They have been technically validated in the workshop
1c Border Biosphere Reserve is not created

Targets
1a 57 million ha 100000 ha of new PAs
1b Good management of 350000 ha of existing APs and 100 000 ha of new APs
1c Creating crossborder of biosphere reserve

1a An AP with a total area of 32 657 ha was established by the project by order of 9 May 2011 This is the ZIC of Faragama Thus only 33 of the target was achieved PAG was not performed
The activities in Community Reserves relate 167699 ha but are the first stage of implementation No Community reserve was formally created
Indeed the legal process of establishing the Community Reserve has not begun The prerequisite is the adoption of the bill on wildlife and its habitat But the draft text will be submitted in September 2015 at best hoped for adoption by December 2015 Then the legal texts on the 12 RC should be submitted
1b The project has supported the management of six existing APs from a total of 344 149 ha National Park Kouroufing 55770 ha National Park Wongo 53 499 ha Sanctuary of the chimpanzees Bafing 67 200 ha ZIC Flawa of 73 940 ha Mande Wula Wildlife Reserve 39050 ha wildlife reserves of Nema Wula and ZTT 54 690 ha Field activities exist but are still limited particularly due to the virtual absence of cofinancing Management Plans and reserve management Mande Wula and Nema Wula have not yet been officially approved They have been technically validated in the workshop
1c Border Biosphere Reserve is not created

description.narrative: 4 The total of land covered by an official protection statute

comment.narrative: 5589476 hectares of gazetted protected areas 45 of Malis land area
Approximately 5704696 ha of gazetted PAs over 46 of Mali

Indicator should be dropped according to the MTR which says This indicator is not clear or it is redundant
As noted in previous PIR iterations the Malian territory is very vast Accounting for PA expansion in terms of percentages can therefore be meaningless Accounting for it in absolute terms is already being done in Indicator 1
Hence nothing to report
Just for the record and sake of order

description.narrative: 6a Component 1 Legal regulatory and institutional frameworks

comment.narrative: A min of 20 at least by EOP

Target almost achieved
Component 1 1475 18
With respect to this component part of the Scorecard the project is proud to report progress beyond the actual and percentage points The draft texts of the creation of the new body of management of protected areas are validated They were submitted to the commission for institutional development Waiting for results from the commission
The draft wildlife management and habitat legal texts are technically validated Regional and national consultations were held The final version of the Wildlife Management Code project and its habitats will be submitted to the meeting of Secretaries General before its adoption by the National Assembly by the end of the year
A min of 20 at least by EOP

Target almost achieved
Component 1 1475 18
With respect to this component part of the Scorecard the project is proud to report progress beyond the actual and percentage points The draft texts of the creation of the new body of management of protected areas are validated They were submitted to the commission for institutional development Waiting for results from the commission
The draft wildlife management and habitat legal texts are technically validated Regional and national consultations were held The final version of the Wildlife Management Code project and its habitats will be submitted to the meeting of Secretaries General before its adoption by the National Assembly by the end of the year

description.narrative: 5 Capacity Assessment Scorecard

comment.narrative: see below
see below

broken down by subindicators below herein narrative assessment based on the MTR
The CDS tool permits to measure the increase of the capacities of actors involved in PA management It was applied in 2009 during project formulation It considers the systemic level PA system the institutional level involved entities and the individual level During the MTR MidTerm Review field mission the CDS was applied in order to measure the evolution in terms of capacity development since the project started
The results
Systemic 1230 42
Institutional 1345 34
Individual 921 44
Average 35
The material technical and human capacities granted for PA management are limited and have lightly improved during the project It can surely be explained by the major crisis that Mali had to face institutions have largely been weakened and the State suppressed funds for the PA system in particular the majority of the project cofunding However Mali could have benefited from international skills but the project team did not enlist them
For instance regarding the occupation of the PA capitalization from other West African country could have helped the project team to anticipate and remedy conflicts through mediation A study trip was realized in Senegal but was not enough to find solutions An experience feedback in the Ivory Coast case like in the CORENA project which realized a complete study on occupation of PA could bring solutions on the PA occupation matter
On the field the presence network of forestry agents in Bafing was lightly rehabilitated but not in a sufficient way regarding needs Agents also need motivation and formation to realize their mission Project has effectively realized formation but 60 of the formed agents have been transferred to other situations This cannot allow capitalizing on achievements and continuing them
If material needs are necessary they are not enough The field surveys have brought to light that surveillance is not efficient even if the project brought 18 motorbikes to ease surveillance No infraction was signaled though satellite imagery reveals an upsurge of infractions illegal exploitation forest clearing etc
Financial perpetuation of the NSPA is a major issue and the project team does not have the skills to realized fund seeking which should be the role devoted to the Principal Technical Advisor The financing study of PA does not meet a sufficient quality It is recommended to elaborate a true Business Plan and a pragmatic financial perpetuation strategy by the end of the project
The MTR assesses that the sensitization level of executive officers technicians local and regional decisiontakers communities and other local stakeholders is not sufficient enough for an efficient PA management system in Mali It is indispensable to forecast an important program to reinforce the capacities and also that the next project ERSAP II accepts the idea of benefiting from international expertise to reinforce its own capacities
see below

broken down by subindicators below herein narrative assessment based on the MTR
The CDS tool permits to measure the increase of the capacities of actors involved in PA management It was applied in 2009 during project formulation It considers the systemic level PA system the institutional level involved entities and the individual level During the MTR MidTerm Review field mission the CDS was applied in order to measure the evolution in terms of capacity development since the project started
The results
Systemic 1230 42
Institutional 1345 34
Individual 921 44
Average 35
The material technical and human capacities granted for PA management are limited and have lightly improved during the project It can surely be explained by the major crisis that Mali had to face institutions have largely been weakened and the State suppressed funds for the PA system in particular the majority of the project cofunding However Mali could have benefited from international skills but the project team did not enlist them
For instance regarding the occupation of the PA capitalization from other West African country could have helped the project team to anticipate and remedy conflicts through mediation A study trip was realized in Senegal but was not enough to find solutions An experience feedback in the Ivory Coast case like in the CORENA project which realized a complete study on occupation of PA could bring solutions on the PA occupation matter
On the field the presence network of forestry agents in Bafing was lightly rehabilitated but not in a sufficient way regarding needs Agents also need motivation and formation to realize their mission Project has effectively realized formation but 60 of the formed agents have been transferred to other situations This cannot allow capitalizing on achievements and continuing them
If material needs are necessary they are not enough The field surveys have brought to light that surveillance is not efficient even if the project brought 18 motorbikes to ease surveillance No infraction was signaled though satellite imagery reveals an upsurge of infractions illegal exploitation forest clearing etc
Financial perpetuation of the NSPA is a major issue and the project team does not have the skills to realized fund seeking which should be the role devoted to the Principal Technical Advisor The financing study of PA does not meet a sufficient quality It is recommended to elaborate a true Business Plan and a pragmatic financial perpetuation strategy by the end of the project
The MTR assesses that the sensitization level of executive officers technicians local and regional decisiontakers communities and other local stakeholders is not sufficient enough for an efficient PA management system in Mali It is indispensable to forecast an important program to reinforce the capacities and also that the next project ERSAP II accepts the idea of benefiting from international expertise to reinforce its own capacities

description.narrative: 6 Financial Sustainability Scorecard

comment.narrative: see below
see below

broken down by subindicators below herein narrative assessment based on the MTR
Quoting from the MTR
FSC allows to measure financial sustainability of the PA management system It was applied in 2009 during project formulation at the same time as METT rating and revised in 2013 The project team met important difficulties to obtain financial data it tends to overestimate the obtained scores The total score of the MTR is 27197 14
Component 1 1475 18
Component 2 461 7
Component 3 957 16
Total 27197 14
The evaluation reveals a global improvement of the FSC but still beneath the fixed objectives The law on fauna and its habitat is not yet adopted limiting component 1s score
Regarding the bad quality of financial strategy product 15 not attached to business plan The MTR proposes to upgrade the strategy before attaining a quality document by the end of the project
see below

broken down by subindicators below herein narrative assessment based on the MTR
Quoting from the MTR
FSC allows to measure financial sustainability of the PA management system It was applied in 2009 during project formulation at the same time as METT rating and revised in 2013 The project team met important difficulties to obtain financial data it tends to overestimate the obtained scores The total score of the MTR is 27197 14
Component 1 1475 18
Component 2 461 7
Component 3 957 16
Total 27197 14
The evaluation reveals a global improvement of the FSC but still beneath the fixed objectives The law on fauna and its habitat is not yet adopted limiting component 1s score
Regarding the bad quality of financial strategy product 15 not attached to business plan The MTR proposes to upgrade the strategy before attaining a quality document by the end of the project

description.narrative: Widerlandscape conservation in buffer and transition zones of biosphere reserves of SW Mali will reduce key pressures on core PAs and biodiversity
10 Quantifiable status of vegetative cover in the BafingFalémé Biosphere buffer and transition zones BTZ

comment.narrative:
10a No accurate land use map of PA and BTZ available
10b No marked zoning
10c No clear legal status for BTZ of Biosphere Reserves

10a Arial photography and satellite images treated in GIS
NOTE 2014 a better formulation for this subindicator should be andor
10b BTZs clearly marked on ground direct observation
10c Legal status clarified and understood by 50 of village leaders in surrounding villages questionnaires

Target considered achieved
See comment from MTR
The project obtained and analyzed satellite images of 2010 and 2014 of the BafingFaleme area Ecological monitoring implemented by the project has been able to highlight very strong degradations of the vegetal cover in the area throughout the four years see comments on indicator 3
Main pressures on PA and their biodiversity have not been reduced Images of 2012 and 2015 soon available for the project team will refine the analysis
PCAE Plans Communaux dAction Environnementale were realized 11 communes 3 in Kitas circle 3 in Bafoulabés circle and 5 in Kéniébas circle In order to implement these PCAE Communal Councils must be escorted by the project to obtain funds develop partnerships and ensure their implementation
Identification plates have been posed within migration corridors of the BafingFaleme area However sensitization action whats a BTZ for and formation on bushfires particularly havent yet reached sustainable results Populations escorting must be intensified
The fauna and its habitat management Code includes a clarification of BTZ in Mali Nevertheless this law has not been yet approved see Table 4 BTZ of the BafingFaleme areas are thus not created The evaluation recommends to implement a proactive lobbying to accelerate this legal process
Field surveys showed that populations are confused with the PA classification and to get the differences between each one of them Villagers dont acknowledge limits and functions of BTZ
The midterm evaluation team insists again on the importance of conducting sensitization action preservation cannot be made without the populations
Thus the team rates this indicator MS and recommends 1 to realize an efficient lobbying for the fauna and its habitat law and its decrees 2 to realize a real escort of populations including sensitization 3 reduce realization targets of the BTZ of the project these actions will be able to be continued in a future project still it is important that ERSAP focuses and achieves priority activities

10a Arial photography and satellite images treated in GIS
NOTE 2014 a better formulation for this subindicator should be andor
10b BTZs clearly marked on ground direct observation
10c Legal status clarified and understood by 50 of village leaders in surrounding villages questionnaires

Target considered achieved
See comment from MTR
The project obtained and analyzed satellite images of 2010 and 2014 of the BafingFaleme area Ecological monitoring implemented by the project has been able to highlight very strong degradations of the vegetal cover in the area throughout the four years see comments on indicator 3
Main pressures on PA and their biodiversity have not been reduced Images of 2012 and 2015 soon available for the project team will refine the analysis
PCAE Plans Communaux dAction Environnementale were realized 11 communes 3 in Kitas circle 3 in Bafoulabés circle and 5 in Kéniébas circle In order to implement these PCAE Communal Councils must be escorted by the project to obtain funds develop partnerships and ensure their implementation
Identification plates have been posed within migration corridors of the BafingFaleme area However sensitization action whats a BTZ for and formation on bushfires particularly havent yet reached sustainable results Populations escorting must be intensified
The fauna and its habitat management Code includes a clarification of BTZ in Mali Nevertheless this law has not been yet approved see Table 4 BTZ of the BafingFaleme areas are thus not created The evaluation recommends to implement a proactive lobbying to accelerate this legal process
Field surveys showed that populations are confused with the PA classification and to get the differences between each one of them Villagers dont acknowledge limits and functions of BTZ
The midterm evaluation team insists again on the importance of conducting sensitization action preservation cannot be made without the populations
Thus the team rates this indicator MS and recommends 1 to realize an efficient lobbying for the fauna and its habitat law and its decrees 2 to realize a real escort of populations including sensitization 3 reduce realization targets of the BTZ of the project these actions will be able to be continued in a future project still it is important that ERSAP focuses and achieves priority activities

description.narrative: 11 Stabilization of the number and distribution of threatened indicator or migratory wildlife species in critical habitats to be defined at the projects inception phase indicator adjusted through an added explanation on critical habitats

comment.narrative:
Derby eland 001 individuals km2 estimate
Roan antelope 047 indskm2
Buffalo 012 indskm2
Hippopotamus unknown
Lions unknown
Chimpanzee between 1800 and 3500 individuals in Mali
General target An average increase of 10 in population density at project end surveys Means of verification Species distribution map

Not possible to adequately inform this indicator
Else the MTR reports the following
Aiming to measure the biodiversity preservation within the BTZ of the southwest of Mali 6 indicators were suggested in the PRODOC 1 Derby Elk 2 Roan Antelope 3 Buffalo 4 Hippo 5 Lion 6 Chimps
This indicator is too complex regarding the reality of the project and references figures are not all specified or are unreliable This particular issue should have been raised during launching workshop
Two inventories were realized within the Wongo Complex 2013 and 2014 and an inventory was realized within the GaléLimakollé
A German research team is in the Kouroufing NP They observed 1 Leopard 14 chimps baboons Caracals Damans Genettes Mongooses Panthers and Warthogs on the first recordings watched
The evaluation team recommends to establish a partnership protocol with the research and to offer assistance to write down the TOR Terms Of Reference of an internship with the objective of counting the population of a flagship species within the Wongo complex This internship should begin in September starting of the academic term Master degree internship
General target An average increase of 10 in population density at project end surveys Means of verification Species distribution map

Not possible to adequately inform this indicator
Else the MTR reports the following
Aiming to measure the biodiversity preservation within the BTZ of the southwest of Mali 6 indicators were suggested in the PRODOC 1 Derby Elk 2 Roan Antelope 3 Buffalo 4 Hippo 5 Lion 6 Chimps
This indicator is too complex regarding the reality of the project and references figures are not all specified or are unreliable This particular issue should have been raised during launching workshop
Two inventories were realized within the Wongo Complex 2013 and 2014 and an inventory was realized within the GaléLimakollé
A German research team is in the Kouroufing NP They observed 1 Leopard 14 chimps baboons Caracals Damans Genettes Mongooses Panthers and Warthogs on the first recordings watched
The evaluation team recommends to establish a partnership protocol with the research and to offer assistance to write down the TOR Terms Of Reference of an internship with the objective of counting the population of a flagship species within the Wongo complex This internship should begin in September starting of the academic term Master degree internship
